content.description: Start on the far left of the boulder and slap up the rail with good feet.  Find good holds at the top point of the boulder, get higher feet, and do a "swimming pool" mantle.  Foot ramp is off at the far right side of the boulder
content.location: Middle of the campground parking lot, in front of the brown sign.

content.description: Stand start on left crimp and right undercling.  Compress your way up to a good pinch out right and make your way to the top out.
content.location: Second boulder from the paved path from the parking lot.

content.description: Sit start with right hand on good sloper arete and left hand on bad sloper around the corner.  Use good ramp for feet and throw up to good hold.  Move around left, making use of the good ramp foot, to an easy top out.
content.location: Problem located off paved path west side of parking lot. The first problem you come to and unfortanately there is a bush around the start of the problem, but a pad will fit nicely in front of problem.

content.description: Start on a slopping edge and do a big move to a jug.
content.location: In the middle of the boulder field behind skittles. The boulder sits in a small cove.

content.description: Never actually done them, let me know what you think. And the First Ascentionist doesn't know.
content.location: On the Alcatraz Boulder lookers right of Red Eye Flight.

climbs.name: Mile High Club Stand AKA The Half Mile

content.description: Less of a stand and more of the higher start. LH on the good sloper, RH under cling. Big move to a crimp rail, weird heel, and power to a full pad crimp. Final easy boulder problem to an easy top out.

This was a hell of a project to finish up. Many sessions, many trips over a year of effort. Sit start on a flat edge, with a bad heel. The majority of the climb feels like your doing a hollow body while being punched with V8 moves to a low percentage move. Easy top out.
content.location: The boulder is visible from the parking lot. 2 min approach.

content.description: Sit Start in a small pocket and a right side pull. Move up the arête to a good top out.
content.location: Gorilla Rock. Farthest boulder to the right, directly in the parking lot.

content.description:
Start on obvious jug.  Make your way up pockets to a mantle.

Shorty but goody
content.location: East side of campsite parking lot, next to the first large boulder next to the road leading to the river.  Short boulder with two easy problems.

content.description: SDS: move left off of a small RH side pull and blind feet. Easy top out
Start on good hold on the right side of boulder.  Grab big pockets to the top.  Super short
content.location: East side of campsite parking lot, next to the first large boulder next to the road leading to the river.  Short boulder with two easy problems.
